characters: ABSTRACT SERIES OF CONCERT AND CROWDS.
A LONELY MICROPHONE STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROOM...WA
THIS SCENE WILL BE IN SPANISH.
WE HEAR THE NOISE OF A NIGHTCLUB...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple tenement somewhere in the Bronx. A picture of He in his glory days hangs on a wall. Next to him, a beautif woman, holding on to his arm. He's her prize. She is PUCH the love of his life.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Never never leave you mami...it's not the same thing as being there with you...touching you, kissing you...bueno, I better stop...just wanted to tell you over and over I Love You...and I'm right here with you. See me? Happy birthday Puchi... (singing) Happy...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (to herself) ...never leave me? But you did. She stops the machine. But the pain doesn't stop.  2. She walks into frame. Stands next to the stereo...turns t volume up. She listens to the music...and for a moment do a little sway, tries a couple of steps, but it hurts and stops moving...that's all her broken heart can handle on special day. AN ABSTRACT BLUR FILLS THE SCREEN. RED COLORS...BRIGHT AS BLOOD...and TROPICAL BLUE, as the most beautiful ocean. The colors move...slowly coming int FOCUS.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLAG OF PUERTO RICO
dialogues.text: bobs in the air. It's a CAP someone's wearing. A DIFFERENT STYLE OF MUSIC PLAYS LOUDLY... it rattles the street with bass and attitude. POUNDING RA TITLES BEGIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young Nuyorican kid moves through a busy MIDTOWN sidewa t's 2002. His whole demeanor, rhythm and style is very uch NOW. The walk is the Bronx-Swing thirty years later. CITY ANIMAL in his street war uniform. he hip-hop MUSIC screaming out of an appliance store tell story of rough living and urban anarchy...and it makes th oung man wearing the cap feel like he OWNS LIFE. His and veryone else. He stares back at US, knowing we are watchi im. He knows THE WHOLE WORLD IS WATCHING him. He winks at omeone...at a woman observing him as he struts out of sig t's Puchi.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Now we see her clearly, as she catches her own reflection the store's mirrored panels...her face, lost amongst ever ELECTRONIC gadget imaginable... and the usual array of NY souvenirs. She stares at herself with the same curiosity she did when she watched the YOUNG MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes what she sees. She looks worn and beautifully damaged...someone whose life took as hard as she gave...t EYES you own when you've SURVIVED every war you've create

dialogues.speaker: SHE LOOKS ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Madison Square Garden...yeah there was a time. WE HEAR HE VOICE -- as she goes inside a much more unknown, forgotte and near condemned building on a side street.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: He didn't know how much he had...never believed how much people loved him.  AN ON CAMERA INTERVIEW... Puchi is looking straight through us now. A CLOSE UP ON H FACE...a map of the whole doomed journey now finished.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He had it all...and he had me. She laughs...we hear the laughter. Yes...through that lau we can see there was a time when she had that walk and st and she OWNED LIFE HERSELF...and nothing was going to kno her out of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi looks around the forsaken recording studio, where hundreds of hits were once recorded, now waits silent and empty. She's been here before. A piano sits in a corner crowned with empty cans of soda and dust. Congas ina corner...tipped sideways. A floor littered with maracas a musical instruments...and memories.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...for more than twenty years... A room that has seen better days. Puchi is facing a small crew of YOUNG Latin- music freaks...maybe french-hispanophiles. She smokes nervously trying to glamorize her last fifteen minutes in the spotl

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Was it love? What is? One thing I know; it was special...and when you looked at us, you saw something...so maybe it was. I thought so. I did. (her eyes coming alive) Our life was like a dream... (to CAMERA) Yeah...I know what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IVORY PRINCESS PHONE RINGING is off the hook. The ligh flickers from the candles on the edge of the marble sink bathtub. K.C.'s "Get Down Tonight" kicks in as two perfectly pedic feet with fire red toenails stretch out of the bubbles. O foot clasps around the tub chain and pulls the plug. The shadowy outline of the WOMAN steps out of the tub, gr a towel, and raps it around her voluptuous body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavishly furnished BEDROOM. The wardrobe and accessorie for the night are laid out on either side of the bed. Valentino dress, black silk panties, bra on one side. Go Cartier lighter, monogrammed leather cigar case, her ciga in it, jewelry, fur, purse on the other. THE WOMAN, now dressed to kill, stands in front of a full length mirror. She puts on a GOLD I.D. NECKLACE, the name PUCHI is spell in diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: Was it good love? Well, that's another story.. Puchi gives her devastating beauty a final look of approv then walks out, grabbing a MAN'S WHITE SUIT off the door hanger on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi quickly walks down A DILAPIDATED HALLWAY. Yesterday Gold records and artwork decorate the walls. She goes to another DOOR, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, (55 STREET APT)
dialogues.text: Disco music blares out of the room. A handsome Puerto-Ric man in his late thirties, is startled by her. His name is COOKIE. A combination of many tasks and no specific job. He grabs a jacket, checks his watch and prepares for an u mission.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters of bands on the wall. A teen-ager stares her down it's her son TITO. A handsome, defiant young man.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (to the kid) I don't wanna go out looking for you too when we come home, okay? The man-kid ignores her as best as he can.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF PUCHI TODAY..., (INTERVIEW)
dialogues.text: as she closes her eyes, as if that one memory still BURNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi and Cookie walk out of the building up to a waiting LIMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER WORLD. JUNKIES and PREDATORS move through the tra ridden streets of Loisaida. The place stinks of death and danger.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: Love is never perfect when it's real love... The Limo turns the corner off Ave. D onto 9th Street and stops in front of a squatters TENEMENT BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi walks right up the steps, to a scary, intimidating LOOKOUT GUY at the entrance. She stares him down. He move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi passes by the JUNKIES waiting in line. Doesn't even see them.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: We were meant for each other for better or worse. We both knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very determined Puchi struts down the abandoned dirty h Another LOOKOUT GUY moves aside as his eyes register recognition when he hears the steady clicking of high hee approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...and I don't mean it like today's soulmate type of shit...nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three unshaven, stoned MEN, dressed in dirty sweat suits on a couch, one wearing SUNGLASSES. The table in front of them is covered with drug gear

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: It was old fashioned love. It was good, it was bad, it was beautiful. Puchi struts in. Everyone freezes except the guy wearing the sunglasses, who waves...and smiles, unable to disguis the absurdity of playing dead with so much to live for It's Hector. Just a tad surprised.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hi, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Limo flies uptown. Puchi and Cookie get to work on He like a make over Pit Crew. Off comes the stinky running jacket. Out comes an electric shaver, hair brush toothbrush...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You know I love you...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Yeah...you always love me when you're high.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Yeah...but I'm always high! Puchi pulls out a coke vial....as the Limo takes a fast t she ends up on top of him...and so does the coke. white powder all over his face. Puchi looks at her Hector, lick his cheek and mouth jokingly...she smiles proudly at the craziness of it all.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Look at you. He smiles back...snorting up the rest of the powder spill

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY MASUCCI, a bearded Italian plays nervously with the gold chains around his neck....ready to strangle himself with them.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: It's not his fault...it's yours...and you're my fault. But this is the last time he does this. He points his finger at RALPH, a stocky mulatto skinned balding man. Rican and slick. Ralph's on the phone. He listens, hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (grinning) Elvis is in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People rush down a long corridor. The intro to "El Cantan is heard from the stage as our man walks down the corrido everyone slapping him on the back, like a boxer going int the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! Move! Let the man through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector enter stage, as casual as stepping into his living room. As he turns, he sees what awaits him: 20,000 fans cheering. They stand up for him as he shuffles to center stage.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (singing) Yo soy, Hector Lavoe and... (with a grin) I'm here! Thunderous APPLAUSE follows. The BAND goes into second ge as he continues to sing. Hector made it. HE TAKES A GLANCE OFF STAGE, TO THE WINGS, HE SEES PUCHI. He smiles at her. The world is his...tonight. He kicks into the first verse of : "El Cantante".

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR SINGING
dialogues.text: "Yo, soy el cantante..." THE FACES IN THE AUDIENCE: sheer adulation. (STOCK FOOTAG from those days) HECTOR spreads his arms to his thousands adoring fans. THE PUERTO RICAN FLAG spreads out in the balcony. The crowd CHEERS as the flag DANCES...a subtle but defining political PARTY, live from New York City.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: The more he grew as an artist, the deeper he sank as a person, as a human being...but they loved him. All his faults and trouble....only made him more like one of them... THE MUSIC ECHOES AWAY... as the FLASHBACK ENDS. A POSTER FROM THAT DATE, HANGS ON WALL...the past is long gone, we're in...

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW
dialogues.text: No one is clapping now as she builds up the courage to te the story in her mind. Whatever that is.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He was the singer for his father's band since he was a kid...they played all over the city of Ponce ...X-mas parties, weddings, etc. His father (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: loved him and was very supportive...his mother died when he was three...but he would talk about her as if she was still alive...he never accepted the fact that she was gone. Hector never had it hard...that was the problem. He made it hard for himself because it had all been too easy. She smiles, as if there was only one reason for everythin she does now days. Looks around room, seeing him everywhe

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIWER OS
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about? Caught.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: What do you think? Him...it's always him. The room falls quiet. This is part of the story.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: (a sigh) He never goes away...maybe it's just my fucking guilt. We see PUCHI peeking through the glass inside the SOUND B It's like walking through the Titanic...death everywhere. No one will ever return to this musical tomb.

dialogues.speaker: A LONELY MICROPHONE STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROOM...WA
dialogues.text: FOR A SINGER, suddenly... WE HEAR HECTOR'S VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ".,.recuerdas que, caminando por las calles de San Juan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( a GIG with his father's band...) Back home in Puerto Rico, Hector and his father are singi a duet. Hector plays guitar. A BOLERO PLAYS...angels singing. It's a family reunion. A Spanish guitar and a beautiful song, Panchito Riset's " "Blancas Azucenas". A love story of lovers splitting when one of them leaves the island and goes to New York. A cla San Juan/New York tale of immigration breaking love in tw Later to become sort of a love theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) ...aun guardo las dos blancas azucenas, que me diste hasta despedirte de mi..." Family is watching the magic moment. As the song ends in beautiful harmony of the two men...Hector hugs the old ma with a beautiful voice (CHEO FELICIANO)...with a smile on his face, as he sees Hector enjoying the cheers. The old man turns to Hector and without skipping a beat whispers...totally unexpectedly.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: If you go to New York...just imagine I died. I already lost one son...and I am not going to lose another one. It will be you who loses a father ...understood? (to a woman nearby) Awilda, how'bout a beer for a loving man? He walks away. Leaving Hector shattered. No one around notices the exchange. Hector turns white. It's the nicest threat anyone ever said to him. Tonight it's his father just telling him 'how serious' a felony i would be for Hector to go north. He gets up himself and walks away from the stage, only the sounds of the COQUIS heard out there in the darkness... A BLAST OF NEW YORK CITY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old days in all it's splendor. Tad's Steak, Tie City, The Metropole Cafe, Automats, Theater lights, Penny Arcad etc. TIMES SQUARE in the sixties...a naive version of SIN (STOCK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector's in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as a BAND BOY carries a Trombone case from a VAN ins the stage door, Hector strolls up. Mister Casual. He sees one of them. A young man we know, a younger, confident Cookie, way before LIFE had turned him into a punchy boxe that never fought a fight.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hey, man, you need some help?

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: (looking around) Yeah...hurry up.  10. Cookie grabs a CONGA out of the back. Hector does the sam He follows the band boy in. Cookie winks an eye at Hector In and free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Tropical paradise in the asphalt jungle. The dance floor packed with beautiful, young NUYORICANS dancing to live Salsa music. LARRY HARLOW, a hot new band plays their asses off. Hector notices a stunningly beauti woman dancing by herself on the dance floor...as if danci with each member of the band and busy with every guy in t house. It's Puchi. Younger but never too innocent. Hector sees her, like his dream...a vision he has to look away from, cause she can't be real. Puchi only sees a gee looking guy drooling like he should.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I thought you were with the band?

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: So did I...aren't you? They both laugh. A hopped up cat wearing a silver shark skin suit spots Co It's PAPO, he happens to be Puchi's hoodlum brother. He flashes a gold tooth smile of a warning at Hector...who i hypnotized by the Music and the Scene.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Salsa?

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: That's what they call it here in New York. Salsa...it's a mix of Mambo, Bomba, Son...Charanga. It's like a revolution cooking, bro. Everybody is into it. Welcome to New York Bro! Hector nods...yes, this is better than what he always dre of HECTOR WAKES UP...as a woman screams:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN OS
dialogues.text: Hector wake up!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linoleum, and plastic covered seats. He bolts out of his dream. His sister PRISCILLA, standing by the sofa where h sleeps.  11.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: I'm giving you two more weeks, you hear me? Hector nods.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two weeks to get a job or you go back to Puerto Rico. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What did I do? Wha'happened?

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: I'm serious. I don't want dad to disown me too. Okay? Hector sits up. Confronts her as much as you can when you only wearing baggy shorts and a pajama top.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm here to be a singer Priscilla, not to prove my father wrong. I'll have a job so fast, you wont even know I have a job. You'll be asking "where is he?...where is he...?'. And me...? You'll see. A SUBWAY RATTLES BY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy looking storefront underneath the train in a 125t Street. They walk inside the old nightclub.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Look, these are my friends. The subways rattles by. Hector looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I better get a job or I'm flying back on Eastern Airlines...you told them about me? Hector belts out a couple of lines from a song.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Shit, man...you gotta good voice. This is the best time for you to be in New York. But don't get any ideas. They already have a singer. Just enjoy the show, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is half-empty, a sextet is playing, vamping int song and without a singer.  12. The musicians look a little nervous as they look around f their vocalist. The band is playing "Tus Ojos". A fidgety Hector is stand nearby...singing the song to himself, but loud enough to heard. The leader of the band sees Cookie, who points to Hector...implying 'he can do it...he can fill in'. The gu waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Hector...mira man...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I know that song better than anyone here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: You better. It's now or never panita. Hector does the sign of the cross as he makes his way thr the crowd as the leader heats up the band and introduced Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BAND LEADER
dialogues.text: You're ready out there for a surprise? Cookie wants to die, as Hector walks up to the stage to s the world. The band starts it up and all it takes is one minute for Hector to own the song.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay...okay. (confident) Como esta mi gente esta noche...esperandome, right? I'm here. Hector stays on the stage and steals the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi plays with a gold chain she's wearing. Tries not to look at the Camera in front of her

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...that's how we say in Spanish when you're blessed...you know...some people struggle for years...not him...it's like he always knew it was going to happen...that he'd make it... (the gold cross in between her fingers) This is his... That first time I saw him, he was the most ridiculous guy in the place...but the only one (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: who brought me a present...he didn't even know me...but he had manners that old fashioned thing...I loved that. (to camera) You know, it's my birthday today?

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIWER OS
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. A JOE CUBA BOOGALOO blasts. The MUSIC is coming from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a garden for Puerto-Ricans. The city lights in the back as the sun goes down. All the money in the world couldn't buy you this. A Boogaloo line is on full swing. It's dirty dancing a lo dirtier. Hot Nuyorican beauties. Hector has stepped in th new West Side Story, dressed in a 100% polyester. He thin he looks cool in his Bond's naguahyde leather jacket that you could make a sofa today with it... Jibaro hick in the thick of the SIXTIES MEET THE LATIN TH Joe Cuba playing on the STEREO "Bang Bang". His eyes go straight to a girl in the dancing line, it's Puchi, the g from the nightclub. She sees him...and kind of laughs whe their eyes meet. Little mockery in the way she throws her head back to the music. Hector takes it well. Laughing is a good thing. She's easily the best dancer in the room and she lets Hec see for himself. It's a music video ahead of it's time. The Latino hoodlum we've seen earlier is there...he's car a birthday cake with lit candles and moves all the way in front of Puchi....the music is lowered as the brother sta singing AND SO DOES HECTOR, with the best version of Happ Birthday in the Lower East Side.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Hector pretends he's not alone, when he sees Puchi walkin towards him, like a vision. He's like a hunter who sees t big game coming to him, but can't shoot. He's going to le the animal eat him alive. Once at close range, he smiles Puchi for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hello there...happy happy birthday...sorry I didn't remember your name... Puchi stares at Hector, the look you give a big square hi fresh off the island.  14.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Are you in the right apartment?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I think so... Handing her a present.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: For me? Who invited you? Hector looks around, maybe he's at the wrong place. She opens the present.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (surprised) Chocolates, how sweet. Maybe he's at the wrong apartment.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My brother told me about you. ...you're an actor? Not too famous right? Hector grins sheepishly

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you ...you're Trini Lopez...right?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (Mexican accent) That's right... He manages a little smile from her

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You're the singer, my brother said you're a Singer...right? Well, you are... Hector nods humbly. Cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Bueno...yeah....I am. Everyone's always talking about Puchi this...and Puchi that. And you...? What do you do? You're the famous one.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Me? I listen.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: That's all I need to sing my best...a good pair of... (eyeing her) ...ears.  15.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You're funny...but your pants are even funnier. He checks himself out. He's the only hick in the room wea polyester plaid pants. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (little surprised) They're four dollar pants. Tu eres mala!

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Mala? (flirting) I'm just being me, not mean... honest. Honesty is a virtue, right?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Look, lie to me, tell me these are the most beautiful pants you've ever seen...cause you know what...they're the only ones I got...and unless is okay to take them off...I'm gonna have to wear them al night long.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You will? She blushes. Hector bends in pain hearing the tease... Papo joins them briefly. Lights a joint. Before Hector ca even say hello, he's been handed a joint.

dialogues.speaker: PAPO
dialogues.text: (to Hector) Ladies First...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: No...I don't... Puchi goes for the joint, Papo gives the joint right to Hector.

dialogues.speaker: PAPO
dialogues.text: (to Puchi) You smoke in front of me and I'll kill you. .. (to Hector) do you?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay. (takes it) Thank you. Papo walks away.  16. Hector studies the joint. First joint in his life. He tak a drag and blows it right out. Puchi looks on.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Not like a cigarette, man... (surprised) you've never smoked have you...? Hector fears what to say next, he'll do whatever he's got do to keep her next to him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mira...watch me... (without a joint) ...look, you're supposed to hold it inside. She mimics a smoking lesson specially for Hector. It's al a sexual act. Hector watches fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Wow! Here...let me try it again...I think I got the rhythm of it... He does it, like a good little student. In...and out...an in and out...a turbo-giant toke that he can't hold....GET INTO A COUGHING FIT...HAS TO HOLD on to Puchi. Passes the joint to her, she doesn't want it.

dialogues.speaker: LATER AT THE PARTY
dialogues.text: The night is winding down. Puchi and Hector are Slow danc to the Casino's great LOVE song "Then You can Tell Me Goo bye".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them slow dance around them in the funky livin room.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) ...far out, right? Hector looks blitzed....'arrebatao'. They're now alone in the once crowded room. Hector is only wearing his shorts. and shirt. Puchi is fully dressed. His plaid pants over the sofa. His head in THE SONG:

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: ".,..kiss me each morning for a million years...hold me each evening, by your side...and if it don't work...then you can tell me goodbye..." But it'll work out...for the next 15 years of the tune.  17. It's all romantic and beautiful until Puchi notices Hecto romantic face is turning blue, green, ash and he's losing his balance and he leans closer and closer to her...almos falling over her. She pulls him back, to check him...he's about to pass out. She holds him up, to save him from goi backwards and over the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Not in the sofa...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is being revived by Puchi, as he struggles over th toilet, glancing at her...not sure of who she is or where is or why? A comical but defining moment in their lives. Hector wasted, Puchi to the rescue.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Come on...are you Okay? What's your name papi...come on, I don't want you to die without knowing your name.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hector Perezzz.......

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Don't die on me baby...not on my birthday...promise?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I prom... (he can't finish the promise) He manages a smile from the dead...staring at her...happy be dying in the arms of the most beautiful woman human ey ever laid whatever on. Happy dead. She looks at him...smiling again, coming back to life, gesturing with his chin...something...what?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You need mouth to mouth...resuscitation? Is that it... He nods...yes. She just laughs. He shakes his head...he'll die if he doesn't get it...or dies if he does. From the bottom of this bathroom floor tonight and as dizzy as he was, he was a happy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mannequins dressed in every imaginable bad suit in the wo Hector and Cookie land by the window of the place.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Look at that baby blue tux.  18. A badly hung over Hector explains to his friend Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I can't look... Hector takes a glance at the wigged-mustachioed mannequin has to look away...the L-train rattles above them.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I woke up in her arms, man. Beautiful. She took care of business...

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: What kind of business? Coming up with a lie, an improvisation...an inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...the welfare of a man... dizzy with desire... and passing out with passion...she gave me life back.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: That good?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: No. That bad. I drank, I smoked, I danced and then...I threw up all over the poor girl...I doubt if she'll ever see me again...I wouldn't. They stop before going inside.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: You threw up? She will. Puerto- Rican girls love that savior shit bro...you're in. Did you really vomit? Hector nods.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You deaf or something? I said I vomited...I was so high and dizzy...I don't wanna do that shit again! (re: a suit he likes) I want the green one.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Pliz!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: One minute I was in floor with a goddess...next thing, I was dying in her arms! My luck...  19.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: That's good. That's the best impression you can make with Spanish girls...is being sick. Matrimonio brother! You vomit you marry. They're natural born nurses...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...I woke up in the subway...I rode from Manhattan to the Bronx four or five times, until a cop woke me up...the sun in my face...

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: That's love. It's in the marriage brochure for outside of the island romance! You've been rescued, man....

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You high already? Cookies nods a 'guilty with pleasure' 'yes'.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How am I going to see her again? She liked me!

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: You're almost famous, bro. She'll find you...find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show is wild. The energy is intense as Hector sings a upbeat Salsa tune...and old Tejedor classic: "Escandalo". His charisma with the now- packed- house is mesmerizing. chorus line of beautiful GIRLS DANCE IN FRONT OF THE BAND...instant GROUPIES latino style. But Puchi is the prettiest. Hector is dressed in the gree suit we saw earlier. He sings to Puchi, who dances her wa to the front of the stage with another girl, her sister Z another stunner, both dressed in mini skirts and Go-go bo Puchi puts on a show. The other girls don't have a chance as she elbows and bumps ‘accidentally' at the others...to stake her claim... and drive Hector crazy. He shakes his maracas at her...and she shakes back. It ma him laugh and it gets him down from the stage and wrapped himself around her...

dialogues.speaker: AT ANOTHER TABLE
dialogues.text: JOHNNY PACHECO, thirties, goateed and handsome and WILLIE COLON, eighteen, skinny and dangerous, SIT AT A TABLE wat Hector and the crowd with interest. Willie's yesterday's GANGSTA.  20. 100% attitude, but his smile lets it know that he really likes this new guy Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector steps down after his set and is immediately swarme by GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (yelling over music) Buenas noches ladies! You mind if we sit here with you? Before any of them can answer, Cookie sits, Puchi turns a and sees Hector.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Hello there...Is this a coincidence? Hector moves his chair closer to one to Puchi.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What do you think? He wipes HIS GLASSES off on his shirt, puts them back on.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do I look to you? Like a coincidence? He's wearing the green tux.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You look...like you still need a fashion consultant. You look like a palm tree. Where do you get these outfits?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Is a rental...from Radio City. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector climbs up from the fire escape onto the roof, guit in hand. A few dogs barking. He sees Puchi's window lit...her silhouette walking by. He lets out a song...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (DISCUSS NEW SONG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " The most beautiful sound I ever heard...Puchi...Puchi...Puchi...1I just met a girl named Puchi..." She comes out the window. Sees Hector playing Tony for her...it makes her so happy, he's such a fool in love and is she. She waves at him...to wait, she'll come down.  21. INTERVIEW flash...Puchi 2002.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He was funny. Corny. No one I knew did any of that. Romantic...yeah he was very romantic...that first time together was pretty impressive...yeah...he went all out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie's Chevy Impala's, parked under a broken street lam shakes like a subway car

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: Only the best...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is on top as they make love on the torn back seat.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (breathlessly) Oh, it hurts...it hurts...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What?...What?...me?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: No, the back seat... Hector holds onto her as he FLIPS HER OVER ON TOP. She sm with relief, grabs him with her right hand and starts giv a hand job, winking at him, then starts to wildly ride hi

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on fire) I can't fuckin' believe this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under The Brooklyn Bridge. They're sitting in a small par bench. Smoking the cigarette after

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I don't do this with anyone.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I don't. I bet when you become famous you won't even talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? I'm in love with you already... and I don't even know you.  22. He stops her laughter with kisses. She purrs, kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: What's the first thing your gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: When you become famous, silly. Hector thinks as he watches the lights reflecting in the river.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Why are so sure I'm gonna become famous?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I know about these things. Hector decides to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay. Have a family...and buy a brand new Cadillac. Then we won't have to make love in that old piece of shit...you need a tetanus shot to ride that junk! She laughs. He kisses her, tenderly...we hear music comin from somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR OS
dialogues.text: (singing) ...ever since that night, we've been together...lovers at first sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of ANOTHER night...and not a bad night at all. Th sun is coming up as Hector strolls down the empty street singing to the city....still singing. He's a man in love and in luck...and there's no better feeling.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ",,.Strangers in the night, two lonely people...we were strangers in the night..." A taxi turns a corner from behind him...HEADLIGHTS spotti Hector on his 'street stage', he turns, opens his arms to the cab...his silhouette against the city lights. He's arrived.  23.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dooby doo be dooo..... The cab stops.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, brother...you spic'ingli? Si...? 'Panita', can you make it to the Bronx for $2.50? It's all I got. A FULL BAND KICKS IN AND PLAYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Sinatra never sounded this hot. HECTOR FINISHES SINGING...his salsafied version of "Stranger's in the Nig The club is full, he's bringing in the crowds...and bring in other musicians and producers as well.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR SINGING
dialogues.text: ...in love forever, it turned so right...for strangers in the night..." (soneos) Johnny Pacheco and Willie Colon are here again.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The good guy and the bad guy. Willie with his shades on, good guy living the thug life...and Pacheco, the teacher Their guide through the new sound everyone is calling Sal Hector is surprised they keep coming back. He walks strai to their table.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You guys gotta be lost or something? Are you? Willie make no effort to shake Hector's hand. Johnny does

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (broad smile) Not at all, man. Como esta, my name is Johnny Pacheco from...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (amused) ...from Fania Records. I know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I've been hearing a lot about you we've checked you out. You're good man, you're really good. Willie studies Hector, sipping his drink, pretending to b unimpressed.  24.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Gracias, gracias. (to Willie) I know you too. Willie Colon. Un placer.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tremendo trombone...no saxophone...I like that...me encanta...tu eres muy bueno, 'men'...chevere. Willie nods as he shakes Hector's hand.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. I don't speak Spanish. I like you too, bro.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Pero tu eres Spanish? Willie nods 'yes'.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vaya! Johnny smiles, seeing they're getting along.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE LATER
dialogues.text: Johnny holds court. Hector and Willie listen attentively.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (dramatically) Do you guys believe in destiny? He leans into the table, motioning them to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (almost whispering) Well I do. I believe destiny has brought us to this club, to this very table tonight. (beat) I believe that you two guys have been destined to perform together. I believe that together, you will take this town by storm. He looks from Willie to Hector.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You both have what the other one needs. The younger ones shake their heads at that.  25.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sound good? Hector smiles at the sound of that...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (to Johnny) You're a psychic... Everybody seems to know something about my future I don't. You're that sure? Willie smirks his bad boy smile. Hector picks it right up

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I am. (to Johnny) You have anymore grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet dinner with big sister, who is checking Puchi out protecting little brother.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: This are the best 'habichuelas' in life baby...that's why I still live here...who wants to leave? Priscilla serves Puchi, who tries to be noble and lady like...but suspects the line of questioning.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: Where were you born in the island?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I was born in this island.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Yeah...never even visited Puerto Rico...never seen a real palm tree.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: But now she's got me. Palm trees...beaches...mofongo in person. You eat this habichuelas and your Spanish starts coming back to you. It's like Berlitz dining. They laugh...but still, it seems a point of contention th Puchi is a Nuyorican. She gets it.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Maybe one day I'll make it to Puerto Rico. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking at Hector) I'll get there. Hector takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You're there, mami...next you meet my father. Kisses her hand.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: We're from Ponce. All of our family still lives there. Me and Hector are the only ones here. How long have you guys known each other?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Days...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: But we're destiny, sis. It's his own joke. It's quiet for moment while they eat.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: This is delicious...are they Goya? Priscilla smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: All your family here? Puchi nods.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh...what does your family do? Putting her fork down.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Sell dope...what is this? You're with the FBI or something...I came here to eat, not to be grilled. She gets up...ready to walk out. Hector bolts out of his chair...laughing, making light of it.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: No no...Priscilla is with the Ponce police...come on sweetie...it's cool...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'it's cool'...whose side are you on? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Priscilla) And you? What makes you so...different than me...you British? Gimme a break! Priscilla backs off...even Hector's silent now.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: Sorry...I wasn't trying to come on that way...I'm just doing what a mother, sister, father, has to do...don't take it like that...sit down let's eat...we'll fight later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector looks pretty spruced up...checks himself. New bell bottoms, paisley shirt, etc. Cookie is briefing Hector ab someone he's about to meet. An express train goes by, spo Hector as it roars through the station, but he's getting hang of it.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Jerry used to be a cop, became a lawyer and now he's a thief. Stealing every Latin musician blind...but he's all we got. That's all I gotta say. (finger on his right eye) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The same FANIA OFFICE we've seen before, but now in bett days.) JERRY MASUCCI, bearded Italian, forties, fiddles with his gold neck chains and looks at his watch repeatedly. A biz meeting, Hector is being signed etc.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: We have big plans for you and Willie. But something else has to be decided on...he notices the seriousness of their faces. Like some crisis that has to dealt with soon, before it gets any worst. Hector is a li lost right now.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Starting with a record followed by a tour. Now, do you have a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (nodding to Cookie) Yeah, sure I do.  28.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Have him go over these contracts. Johnny passes the contracts over to Hector They look on with intrigue as Hector appears to be carefu going over the documents himself.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: They're good. Got a pen? Johnny hands a pen to Hector who signs with a crazy grin.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (as he signs) Hectorrr... Pe...rezzzz! Jerry and Johnny look at him shocked but sure as hell don try to stop him. They are very pleased.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (keeping his professional composure) Now, there is one more thing, and we all gave this a lot of thought...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Something I did? Pacheco nods 'no'

dialogues.speaker: MASUCCI
dialogues.text: That name's gotta go... Hector doesn't know who they're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Who's gotta go?

dialogues.speaker: MASUCCI
dialogues.text: You...your name. It doesn't mean a thing.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Perez?

dialogues.speaker: MASUCCI
dialogues.text: Yes, Perez. It's an unemployment line name...you gotta have a name that unemployment line looks up at. Very politically incorrect.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: MASUCCI
dialogues.text: Lavoe...  29.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: La...que?

dialogues.speaker: PACHECO
dialogues.text: (pipes in) Lavoe... 'the voice'. Hector thinks, looks around the table. This means a lot t all the money people...so, what the hell.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Lavoe. Won't the people think I'm French? Masucci starts to explain, but notices Hector is putting of them on. They all laugh. THE MUSIC STARTS... as the sounds and the voices in the scene FADE... a tromb solo RIPS UP IN New York somewhere...followed by congas a more drums and a band in full throttle...playing for thei life. A new sound baptized as salsa is being born in the studio tonight. A mix of MAMBO, CUMBIA...RUMBA, JAZZ, BOM CHA CHA...all of it together like a gumbo: A sauce...SALS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAD...now prosperous and new) Here, history is being made inside..Though they might not know it, the magic is in the air and each musician plays furiously and freely. It's a session that will change Lat Music.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Hector singing in the SOUND BOOTH at Fania Studios. The CORO OF SINGERS...like soldiers...firing up after the MON MIDTOWN ROOFTOP... Hector and Puchi are MAKING LOVE ON THE ROOFTOP of the st Underneath the water tower, with the city watching...he t her.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Do you know how much I love you? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: No...tell me.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Well, look out there...see everyone of those little lights...  30.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (teasing him) The windows...? Hugging her.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Baby, the stars...they're shining for you...saying: 'Puchi, I love you like no one's ever loved you...baby, I love you'...and every night you look at them, they'll be there...saying the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Really? I heard that in the 'novela' the other night... They laugh and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Willie tearing his heart out with a Trombone that speaks every language in life. Hands playing the Congas so fast Timbales rolling up the dancing thunder...an electric bas pumping the 'new move'. HECTOR SINGING... Puchi watching. Willie and Hector singing harmony...a special moment as w see these two guys singing into one Microphone...their ey connected, lit up with that special sync, like you're ado an invisible God that stands between them.. so they don't electrify one another to death: it's the rapture of the M (if you've seen it, it's like watching two lover's making

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY The studio looks empty. End of the session. The song is PLAYING, but all the musicians are either lyi on the floor or inside the booth listening. Willie sits close to the sound engineer....outside in the studio, we Hector...like the crazy person he is, talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: See what your son is doing mami...not bad, tell dad about it, okay...he listens to you. Puchi sees him. Understand him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces, sings to himself. Listens to the playback of hi first songs ever recorded. His first to be a HIT. "EL MAL "Que Lio", "Che Che Cole", etc. He dances with Puchi insi the empty studio...lost in the moment. Salsa Heaven on Ea (A GIMME SHELTER ("Wild Horses") STYLE SCENE - In a way i like a scene out of a Rolling Stones recording...same dri same days, young people making music no one's heard befor Good drugs, beautiful women, YOUTH...and that feeling WHE YOU KNOW YOU GOT SOMETHING RIGHTEOUS going. --A PEEK INTO THE LIFE OF A SONG...and being young and eternal) THE MUSIC SEGUES OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Under the Brooklyn Bridge or downtown Beach St ALLEY) Hector and Willie are both dressed like old- fashioned GANGSTERS. WITH GUNS AND AN OLD HOODLUM CAR next to them. They're shooting the album cover for the cover of "EL MAL Living so much in this moment, with their guns and admiri women and FLASHING CAMERAS and a future....yes...the good times were never going to end.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Not bad... Willie adjusts his Al Capone hat. Swaggers closer to the Rolls Royce. He's in a marijuana sixties latitude. Heavy and... heavy. Profound street justice talking.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: (smoking) Crime pays Hector... (coughing) this is 'nuestra cosa'...our Latin thing.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (confused) I was just talking ‘in character'...you know?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I wasn't. CAMERA FLASHES...he sees a beautiful face in between the blinding lights: Puchi, arriving to the shoot, grinning happily when she sees Hector dressed like Zorro from Chic She brings a smile to his face...

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER OS
dialogues.text: Hector...come on, you gotta look bad, man...tough...come on!  32. They can't help to bring out their best in each other onc in a while, like now. With a lust so strong, it's scares you blind. Willie keeps mumbling...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: (in the background, still waxing poetic) It's gonna be good to be Nuyorican holding up a trombone instead or a tray or a hotel elevator... A NEEDLE being place on a 33RPM ALBUM. "Juana Pena" plays over...BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS CUT WITH CONCERT SHOTS...
dialogues.text: 8mm HOME MOVIES. TOUR FOOTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIAMI. Hector, Willie and band having a drunken, rowdy po party amongst normal guests. The manager comes, Willie to him in the pool. Shots of life on the road. A collection of fun memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transistor radio plays Jose Feliciano's hit "California Dreamin". The band members are all passed out in one of t rooms. Hector walks down the hotel corridor. It's the end of a n on the road. Parties in every room. He finally reaches hi own room. Inspects the key and room #. Opens the door. Th place looks too quiet, too serene. He hears a faint noise coming from the bathroom...the fluorescent light spilling into the dark room. He shuffles slowly to the bathroom. As he opens the door he catches Cookie wrapping a belt around his arm, a SYRIN between his teeth. He stares at Hector...who watches the DRUG RITUAL, disgusted, at first.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Get in or get out, man. He closes the door behind him. The needle, a foot away fr his face. THIS WAS THE MOMENT HIS PAIN WAS WAITING FOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small time drug dealing up and down the block. Hector, is wearing a semi superfly suit and hat.  33. They sit on Papo's stoop sharing a joint. A RUNNER strolls over and hands a BROWN PAPER BAG to Papo Hector nods and grins widely. Papo turns into a reefer- street- corner philosopher and lays it out...as stoned an as real and believes it himself.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...once you leave the island you're not really attached to anything, right? Papo doesn't really sees it like that.

dialogues.speaker: PAPO
dialogues.text: (stoned wise) You are. To the other island...Riker's Island...where you'll go, even if you claim it was 'self defense'. Now Hector is lost in the street philosophy jive...but sl it becomes clear...and so does his predicament.

dialogues.speaker: PAPO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Puchi's a tough woman, man. I could'a killed her myself a couple of times...but, hey...I'm her brother'...so let me give a little advise; ‘don't fuck with her unless you wanna fuck with her'. You wanna fuck with her, fuck with her. You got my blessing. Live for today, man, we're family. Papo laughs. A staggered second later, Hector laughs. Fuc it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The energy is intense. The packed dance floor is on fire. Willie is in the middle of a smokin' Trombone solo with a flirtatious DANCER right in front. He sits on the edge of the stage and PUMPS THE TROMBONE SLIDE as the dancer lite STRADDLES IT. Zaida, followed by A VERY PREGNANT PUCHI.

dialogues.speaker: ZAIDA
dialogues.text: Move outta the way! Lavoe party comin' through! Puchi pats her stomach. Hector sings "Que Lio" as a group of love- struck girls g at his pants.  34. Hector gives a wink to Puchi, who's standing behind a sid table with the Fania business guys. Priscilla, Ralph, Jerry...the entourage. Puchi smiles, blows a kiss. Puchi pushes herself up. The music building, the congas: crazy. We see her belly...and so does Hector.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (to no one) Excuse me. She makes her way to the front of the stage...and just st there. Puchi and future family. Hector knows what's up opens his arms wide and yells into the Mic.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (singing/soneo) Okay, would you marry me baby? I'll marry you, if you put it that way... Puchi nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still improvising) ...I am gonna married this woman...because I love her and if I don't...Ay Que lio!! Candanga con Burundanga!! Te quiero de gratis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Interview CONTINUES....

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He looked like an innocent choir boy jibaro, but he wasn't. BACK TO SCENE... THE INTERVIEW. Puchi shakes her head...as if listening to him...and agre with whatever he's saying. She's almost IN A TRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were both pregnant. (she still has a memory) The other ‘woman in question'...doesn't really matter at this point...it wasn't meant to be, right? I am the only woman. Whether this is what the film crew came for, or not, this what they're getting. The love story. The heartbreak stor Fuck Hector's music life...everybody knows that...this is Puchi's Confidential.  35.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just put a little more pressure... or he liked me better...the day Hector was at the baptism for his other son...he left the church and came over to see me. He said: "I'll take you to Puerto Rico and marry you baby"...and he never left. Men we still men then... THE OCEAN WAVES BREAK AGAINST THE REEF...

Zaida and the BRIDESMAIDS look at her blankly as she strolls down the aisle...like a gunslinger.

dialogues.text: Somebody give me a cigarette. Zaida lights one, gives it to her. Puchi paces. Turns to Ralph, who has just walked in. The Priest just chills, ho against hope, this is all a nightmare about to end.

dialogues.text: Of course I was. Just calm down...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI

Band members with CHICKS passed out on a couch and floor...the debris of a good Led Zeppelin party. The stillness of dea ecstasy. Puchi walks over to Willie, who's sleeping on another cou in his BOXERS with a GIRL in her bra and panties.

dialogues.text: Oh, shit... (sees the priest) Good morning Father. Willie searches his pants, as if looking for change, brin out the RING BOX. Puchi drags him over to the BED where Hector is PASSED OUT in his boxers.  37.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)

Hector is there with them, singing to the radio the song. Lip synch himself. Beers, cheers, joints...as they sing and dance, as if on stage....suddenly, one of them spots a COP and elbows Hector...who happens to be taking a toke of the joint. Hi lungs about to explode, when he sees the cop coming strai at him. But no one stops or runs...the whole gang stays i place singing...going down with the ship.

dialogues.text: "Isla Linda y bonita de palmeras benditas... The cop arrives as Hector exhales to a side...impossible hide this much smoke...but before he can raise his hands surrender, the COP TAKES THE MARACAS away from him and st playing like a pro. The rag tag band is livid and close t heart attack conditions as Hector and the COP HARMONIZE i the chorus.

dialogues.text: ...yo le canto a la isla del encanto... No one is getting BUSTED TONIGHT. The MUSIC BLASTS: BLOCK PARTY/ EARLY FANIA MAGIC...in Spanish Harlem. The audience shouts:  39.

dialogues.text: ...Puerto Rico!!!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( ALT: SAN JUAN/PUERTO RICO STREETS )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are filled with the magic of the music and al of the sudden the sidewalks are turned into pieces of San Juan, Mayaguez, Bayamon or wherever you came from...peopl dancing and cooking and laughing and feeling more togethe than they had...a Puerto Rican RENAISSANCE in Manhattan. Dancing in the streets...and on the bandstand, some of th most handsome and fun young singers of the day; Ismael Miranda, Willie Colon and Hector...in his pink glasses an wide hats...and Johnny Pacheco, the band leader supreme. The song Hector's singing is "PUERTO RICO". A gem of a so almost an anthem to Puerto Rico. If there was ever one moment that galvanized a broken up community, it was NOW. The after sixties- seventies. NOW you weren't afraid of being what you where...and you said loud: Puerto Rican and Proud! The seeds of a NUROYICAN NATION, if there was ever one. Puchi notices as Hector leaves the stage. LATER... Nighttime. Same neighborhood, different circumstances. HECTOR SCORES. Ends up in some filthy little stairway wit some of his FANS...and lots of dope. A post wedding conce celebration, riding the glorious first year of a secret h habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( ALT: LA PERLA - PUERTO RICO )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear voices...someone walking up the stairs. A junkie peeks out the door to his apartment to see what's up.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OS
dialogues.text: (rushing up) Hector's here, man... But they're not talking about music. Around the landing on the last floor is Hector alright. H jacket is off and he's just finished shooting up. He's rolling down his sleeve...jiving happily, dope rushing an rapping.  40.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (sees more dope arriving) Vaya! This is where it's happening tonight, man...where the fuck are we?

dialogues.speaker: JUNKIE
dialogues.text: Heaven bro, Here...another bundle...on the house. Around him, three or four Lower East Side hard core dope fiends party with the man. Yes, Hector is theirs too.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HECTOR'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Puchi is sitting in the living room, pissed. It's one of many nights she's learning to live with.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I just bumped into some friends, men...and you know how it is...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Yeah, It's okay. I know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I was doing nothing... She gets up and gets on his face, grabbing his arm.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: And what is this on you sleeve? A blood test you had done after the show...come on Hector...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Baby...it's nothing, just having a little fun, experimenting and shit...it's nothing. Everybody doing it. Come on. Everything is good...let's not...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Let's not what? But Hector can't say it, not with any honesty, so he keep quiet. If she's ever right, it's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck it up? You think I don't know? You know how many friends I had who never got to take the fucking needle out of their arm...you think that growing up in the streets doesn't (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: teach you something? Please...you have family now...I don't wanna bury you on your son's third birthday.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Oh...come on. Now you're the school cop? You get high...you like this shit... She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: No. Not that shit. (her back to him) That's not getting high, man...in my book, that's killing yourself. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hector please...I don't wanna be the school cop. You make it, I make it. Let's make it. He walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'll be careful...nothing's gonna happen. ..okay? The song "MONEY, MONEY, MONEY" plays over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MONEY COUNTING MACHINE counts bills. Willie and Hector each take a stack. They look like the characters from the gangster album cover, they're living life. Early Scarface. A FLASH BULB goes off...MUSIC PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE FLASHES. The room is filled with REPORTERS and PRESS PHOTOGRAPHERS interviewing Hector, DRESSED IN A SHARP WHI SUIT AND COOL PRESCRIPTION SHADES, and Willie, DRESSED IN ALL BLACK. Both hold GOLD RECORDS in their hands. Jerry, Johnny, and Ralph, big smiles, stand behind them. SUDDENLY THEY FADE from the room...and we are in same room present time, with Puchi.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi is walking around, almost recognizing the 30 years cigarette butts on the ashtray. Searching for a sign of life. Her old life.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...Hector never really left Puerto Rico, it was more like he brought Puerto Rico over here with him. He...showed us...but didn't know it. LIVE MUSIC PLAYING...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was simple...and he had all the island we were missing...that was the thing with Hector. His English was bad, our Spanish was worse...and it clicked. He spoke like family...like someone you knew all your life...his problems were your problems. She straightens one of the Gold records left on the crack wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector stands outside on the front lawn, holding a now FO YEAR OLD Tito's hand. Puchi opens the door to them. It's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire place is going in the living room. The little boy standing in front of Hector...he looks sad.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: If you also wanted the little train you better go out the window and tell him, scream it... (mock scream) "my little train'...just say you forgot... Little Tito doesn't really buy it....

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead...tell him before he travels away from Queens. The boy runs to the window and begins hollering....  43.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: (top of his lungs) I forgot to ask you for a little train Santa....please....I forgot....a little train... Hector smiles as he watches his naive little son remind S of the forgotten toy. His turn to be a good father. The little voice is lost in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falling. A WHITE X MAS...

dialogues.text: Santa Claus is outside Hector's house, smoking a joint. H picks up his Red Bag of presents and climbs up a small la goes through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. A little toy train runs through the tra in the living room...a tricycle next to it...along with m other toys. Little Tito appears at the end of the big roo cued by Puchi. The kid sees the train, wide eyed...and ne fainting...he also sees the legendary white bearded man f the cards, the signs, now standing by the moonlight, righ across from of him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (latino Santa) Ho Ho Ho! Are you little Tito... The little boy can barely stand, nevertheless speak...he just stares...Puchi speaks for him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Tito...di que si... (like the boy) Si...I'm Tito. The boy moves a little closer, seeing the train going aro him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: This is all for you little boy...a present from Santa Claus...bye bye! (to Puchi) Tell his father...he's a good boy. Ho Ho Ho...I'm a good boy too...Ho Ho Ho... Santa disappears in the night...we hear a crash after he clears the window...and some grumbling in Spanish. WE HEAR THE SOUND OF THE 'tres' playing softy somewhere..  44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi is asleep, alone in the bed. Right in front of her is Hector, wearing his pajamas, admiring her, walking aro his sleeping beauty, the baby is next to her, lying by he side. He cannot believe his luck...they're his. We hear the sound of a 'cuatro' playing somewhere...a ple lullaby. He slowly, not to wake anyone up and spoil the magic of the moment, gets himself in the bed next to her Moving toys out of the way, he rests his head next to Puc and a Firetruck. The SOUND OF THE 'cuatro" continues... YEARS LATER...ANOTHER CHRISTMAS... "Asalto Navideno"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FELIZ NAVIDAD! The whole room is filled with friends. Willie, Johnny Pacheco, Ralphy, Jerry, Priscilla, Papo, e Everyone richer; everyone slicker. A big Puerto-Rican fea on a long table, in the middle of a SUPERFLY fashion blas On the walls: Leroy Neiman 'salsa' renditions of Hector a other Spanish icons. We peek. It's all candid. Real life. Everyone is singing the same 'plena'. Tonight, Famous Latin musician Yomo Toro does the honors playing the little 'cuatro' guitar...bringing into snowy York all the heart and soul Jibaro music. We see Tito, no a happy six years old boy singing along, helping mom out. We also notice a small little poodle wearing a jibaro cou hat, a 'pava'...running around...into Hector's arms. Puch savors every bit of it. This was a great happy time, nothing would ever be the sa THE MUSIC FADES OUT. THE IRIS CHACON SHOW IS ON TV... the wild Puerto Rican vedette camping it up, during her f TV days.

dialogues.text: Puchi dubs the song as Iris dances and shakes her made-he famous- sculptural behind. She's doing an early Tongolele/Grace Jones in the tropics choreography. Leathe and banana.

dialogues.text: Te gusta?  45. Hector is sitting in the living room of their apt sipping Schaefer beer. Glassy- eyed, mellow.

dialogues.text: Mami...mira. Move your behind so I can see her behind...ces't vou pliz

dialogues.text: How much you wanna bet? She turns to him. Mock-encabrona.

dialogues.text: You know papi. This one you can touch...this one is yours...and that one...? She does a little dance for Hector, imitating Iris, block the TV set. Hector pretends to be looking for the TV, the bolts out of his seat, grabbing PuchI from behind...kissi her neck, she laughs...he loves it too....these are two p madly in love with one another

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me alone... They fall on the floor, in the background, IRIS CHACON bu and grinding, climbing on top of a Harley Davidson...as P climbs on top of poor skinny little Hector, and starts removing her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with a wicked smile) You wanna watch TV...do you papito? You wanna change the channel? She starts kissing Hector...considers...

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHT
dialogues.text: This... She bites his lip...starts unbuttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: It's just starting...isn't it.  46. He looks at her, touching her face gently. She nods 'yes' He kisses her face over and over.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know... I always dreamed of having someone like you. Kisses her...she kisses him back...and then, he pulls awa

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Now? You nuts? I don't like that stuff...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (getting up) Yeah...but you like me... (a little devil) Right? Come on... He takes a vial out of his pocket. MARVIN GAYE PLAYS ON THE STEREO. "Inner City Blues". IT'S MUCH LATER... YEARS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they're an experienced wasted couple...in their new ho Still half- dressed. Wired and just realizing that it's a daylight, again. Hector's lying on the floor next to Puchi...who is crawling around the expensive glass table. drugged predator. Another wasted couple (Willie & Wife) parties around in another part of the living room. Pool w shimmering in the walls... Willie tries his best stoned playing the grand piano in t living room, gives up and walks out into a patio: An elec blue pool empty, waiting for a swimmer.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (in a bit of a panic) Shit...we don't have anymore. Hector smiles, smoking his cigarette, drinking his vodka. little something hidden up every sleeve. He moves to a so

dialogues.text: Says who? Puchi turns to him. First mad, then glad...still on her knees. He's dangling a little coke bottle in his hand.  47.

dialogues.text: But you gotta do something for me first... Like a dog...he parts his legs open.

dialogues.text: Baby...look at her... The woman is dancing seductively with Marvin Gaye, unawar of the conversation. Maybe not.

dialogues.text: (softly) You always wanted to... make it with a girl...right? You said that.... Puchi looks at him, tempted, does a line before giving an answer.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'd like that... The woman joins her man in the patio, starts stripping to for a swim, working the diving board like a runaway slut.

dialogues.text: How'bout you...
