dialogues.text: I'll just watch... (does a line) Cleaning up her nose...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Yeah...but you go first with...him, with Julio...come on, I wanna watch too...come on papi... He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Puchi...it's not supposed to be like that...you're fucking with me?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Why not? It'll turn me on...you like men? You said that one night... Hector looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Of course not!...That's Willie! I am aman...anyway, you'll be jealous baby...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: No I won't...come on papi...go get him. Willie jumps in the pool wearing his suit, let's out a holler...the woman laughs. Sits by the edge of the pool. She spreads her legs slowly... stylishly dirty.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then I'll do her... They both start laughing at the absurdity of it. Hector...hears a noise, he looks. A seven- year old Hecti is watching his father and mother in some strange adult f scene.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...we liked excess, yeah...we both shared that...that sickness...that crazy game...the whole insanity of the coke and having everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confessions, accusations...the 30 years later version of lone survivor, when the truth goes in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...he went far, I went further... There's no denying it. (with a smile) We were terrible for one another. That was the whole basis of the relationship...see who could bang the other one harder in the head...

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Hector SNEAKS THROUGH THE BACK DOOR OF SOME CLUB. Puchi i waiting for him and as soon as he hits the street, she sm  49. the other woman on her head and then goes for Hector...be the shit out of him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What....what the fuck you're gonna say... you bitch...eh? Who's that bitch...your aunt...? Puchi punches him....as the other woman runs away and no dares stop the fight. Only Hector who grabs her and shove her inside her car, parked by the alley. Once inside the car, they look at each other....and start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: To Puchi 2002. Getting a drink. A cigarette, acting like she was 'busy' backstage somewhere, in a big concert hall where Hector is about to perform. She lets her hair down.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I remember too much... Very faintly, WE HEAR THE VOICE OF AN MC ANNOUNCING A SHOW... 'Ladies and Gentlemen...would you...etc'. She dri gone for a second.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR OS
dialogues.text: I never forget you. HECTOR's TALKING... it looks as if he was talking back to Puchi.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (ref: audience) ...I'm lucky I got you...well, I don't know how lucky... RAPPING IN BETWEEN SONGS as he used to, just everyday talk...his special way of relating to his audience...from flat tire to a broken heart...yesterday's news or tomorro doom or insults. An old black and white piece shot somewh in the trail, nuggets from the top. Hector does his stand up between songs.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Llet me see...my mother died when I was three, my brother died when I was 15, my grandmother just died...Jesus, I'm gonna have to kill myself so I could have some company! Don't go anywhere mi gente Laughter from the crowd. Someone shouts 'sing'. Hector fl them the 'bird'.  50.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (acting lost) Fuck you too. Now, what was your question? Oh...the next song we're gonna play? MUSIC STARTS... MUSIC PLAYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this COULD BE a PUERTO RICO show- OUTDOOR: LA PERLA, SAN JUAN PARK, ETC or THE FLOAT/PR day parade idea--check)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FANIA ALL STARS AT THEIR BEST. Raw and intense. Camer rolling. But the band is totally unaware of HISTORY BEING MADE TONIGHT. "Quitate Tu Pa'Ponerme Yo" grooves on, six the best singers in Salsa sharing a stage and a magic mom Puchi is on the side of the stage. A witness to the frenz and part of it...as she dances again for him. Ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR SINGING
dialogues.text: "Move out of the way...quitate tu!"

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: The noise of the PRESS, the impressed, musicians, manager groupies and the usual shatter and electricity of ‘after historical show'. A happy Hector is in the middle of this beautiful moment, as he realizes that Puchi is next to him...sharing the success and the feeling of HAVING IT ALL...of getting here together...and holding on to one another. He gets to make himself invisible in front of everyone an hold her face close to him...the most important face to h on to.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Do you believe this? She doesn't need to look around. She believes in him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) I love you...and you're here with me. (taking the room) It's our time. I mean...you and me. They stare at each, Puchi beaming, giving it all up for h and his dreams coming true.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I love you.  51. The corniness and magic of the moment, is tainted by the little sly move that no one sees, but we all know, as she passes into his pocket a small little vial...it's a littl moment that will be big and damaging in their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco music is heard in the b.g. The previous joy and pea is out the window. It's tense inside this room. Puchi sits on a couch with a glass of CHAMPAGNE, smoking large cigar very elegantly, dressed to kill in silky, ric looking black dress. Willie leans against the door holdin on to his Trombone...anxious to get the show going...but Hector's MIA. Willie and the band stand around upset...si the before the show shatter all wasted. Ralph taps his wa pretending it's not the 20th time he's done it in an hour

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I'm not a fuckin' baby-sitter...I'm his wife...in case you forgot.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You don't know where he goes? Everybody else does...wife.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Then go find him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I don't care if he makes you wait...he's not gonna make me wait...I worked too hard to get to stand on that fucking stage. Puchi gives Willie an amused fuck- you- smile.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Did you really? It's tense and ugly and different, because it's a woman snarling in a man's world.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: (to Ralph) Why is she here? Willie walks out.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Willie is right. You shouldn't be defending Hector this time...he's fucking up.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Did anybody ask for their money back? Ralph never gets to answer.  52.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: _, (pushy) Did they? A moment later, Hector casually walks in...with Willie.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Everybody out! I gotta talk to Hector. Hector smiles, unaware of any problem, ready with a true- tale of Lavoe's life. After a brief stare down, Ralph wal out followed by the band...Puchi stays.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Puchi) You too....please. She struts out.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Cono man, my dog ran away with my car keys...ate them...I had to borrow a neighbor's car to get here. Hector gives Willie a sheepish smile.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: You fuckin' happy with yourself?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I don't know...what did I do? That was a true story. Willie almost laughs, but holds on to playing the bad cop

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: It's me Hector. Not the others. I like to fuck around too, Hector but I take this seriously.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: So do I, bro...Willie, listen...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I wanted you in my band because I saw you had a one in a million voice. And we've gotten far. But if now you wanna fuck yourself up, do it on your own time, not on mine...understand? You need help I'll help. Off Screen we hear, the MC announcing the start of the sh

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You know I love you, man.  53.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: If this is about love, try lovin' yourself, I get plenty of love and still get here on time. He embraces Hector...with love, with care.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm your brother. Come on, let's kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driveway is packed with cars, half parked on the fron lawn. A NEW MERCEDES pulls up, parks on the street. Puchi jumps out of the car when she sees Tito skating.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHT
dialogues.text: Shit! Tito rides up on his skates.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Hi, mommy...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here at this time? The boy stops, unsure he's doing anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Playing...dad said it was okay.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Get inside! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi flies into the living room, dragging Tito by the ha

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Where is he? As Tito shrugs...GUN SHOTS ring out from under the living room floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band is hangin' out in the Adult Play Room. BARRY WHI blasting from a JUKE BOX. "Never Never Gonna Give You Up" Hector mocks and lip-syncs Barry. A few guys play pool on a NEW POOL TABLE. A couple of oth take pot shots with .45's at a DART BOARD riddled with bu holes, hanging on the wall, also riddled with holes.  54. A couple of others sit on a plush couch with Hector, who holds a TRAY FULL OF COCAINE in one hand, a GUN in the ot More shots are taken at the dart board. Just as a GUY lea in to take a snort off the tray. Puchi FLIES down the stairs, races over and SLAPS the who tray INTO THE AIR.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (crazy mad) Everybody get the fuck out! Now! Everyone scrambles to get out. As the guy attempts to sno some of the lost cocaine off the couch, Puchi kicks him i the ass.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hijo de Puta! Hector is left alone, standing with the tray in his hand gun in the other.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Puchi, that was some good shit...two grand worth of it! What got you crazy tonight? Puchi grabs the tray and whacks him in the head with it. Hector is too stunned to do anything but back away.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You let our son out on the street at ten o'clock at night while you're down here with these fuckin' low life leeches...in my house, getting high and shooting off guns!!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Tito was fine until you came home. All the time, the gun in Hector's hand. Puchi looks at it...it's implications and possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (calmly) Put that fuckin' thing away. Hector, belts the gun, shrugs and starts for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pretend this didn't happen.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Yeah...like you always do....it's the story of your life. Nothing happened. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your mother didn't die, your father doesn't hate you...and your brother's still scoring dope in Harlem somewhere. She's crossed the line

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where you goin'? To do more drugs? To spend all our fucking money on drugs? She goes after him, tries smacking him in the back of the head with the tray. He pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You know the problem with you? You should'd been born a man, not a woman. You would've been a great tough guy. Hector starts to run up the STAIRS. Blood running down hi face.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You motherfucker! As she races after him, wildly swinging the tray... She looses her balance, FALLS ON THE TRAY and SLIDES DOWN THE STAIRS. HECTOR looks back at her. She's okay. He laug and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector walks to his car. Puchi chases him after him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Leave your wife and son! You no good piece of shit junkie. He turns around...making sure this is his wife screaming all this horror.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You heard me, yeah, I said that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is empty. Except for Willie. Hector has already cleaned up a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: You have two problems....and I don't know which is harder to quit...  56.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...neither, cause I'm used to both of them...and learned to live with both of them...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: But one will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I think drugs are easier to quit than that woman... They remain silent...just the jukebox playing oldies. Hec watches the traffic. Imagines all the happy people passin by in their cars.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I cannot tell you what to do...stubbornness runs in the family... Hector turns to him, smiles....trying to shift the conversation. Or finally knowing what to say next.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You know, there's this cop, this woman cop...comes to a lot of my shows...says she loves me...I don't know whether she wants to marry me or bust me...should I just raise my hands and walk out peacefully...? They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: You'd be better off arrested...right now any way...look at you....you're like The Fugitive...remember how much you used to like that show? Well, you've become that man...running away from something you haven't done.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Willie, I'm not that innocent either... Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and I love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector comes to serenade her in the middle of the night. ask for forgiveness in the only way he knows how, or the he dopes it best. A guitar and maracas...like an old fashioned trio from a time warp, in the sidewalks of Quee  57. Hector singing the most romantic and heartbreaking bolero life. Willie is with him...ragged trombone moans and all. Puchi eventually comes out the window...nodding, hushing first....then pretending to be forgiving...just in time f the neighbors to become a selected audience to a love tri put to music, as Hector sings soulfully Tito Rodriguez's heart-breaking "Inolvidable". But this alone will not do the trick. INSIDE THE HOUSE ( different exterior LOCATION 7?) Puchi listens. Hector explains Hector.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...I'm sorry baby...what else do you want me to do? She just lets him hang in that awful space a little bit longer.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...I forget what I have... it's like that. He opens his arms, in that classic and final gesture...finished with his defense and ready for sentenc

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You know, people tell me I should just dump you...you know how fuckin' pissed off that makes me? (beat) Because I love you... and I love Tito... and I want us to be together It's that too much? Isn't that what you want? But she doesn't even know what she wants to say or hear.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hector...I just...I just want you to say ‘you're gonna try to make things work'. I want you to say you're gonna spend more time with Tito. I want you to say you're gonna stop with all the drugs...I want you to say you love me.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Puchi, you want a lot. I do love you...but I can't make that many promises in one night....I'd be lying to you. Of course I love Tito...it's got nothing to with that...and I know how much to give to me...it's just...  58. And it comes out silent. His pain has always been private...maybe the one and only thing left all his. Puchi's serious demeanor starts to crack after hearing th words.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Do you think we could try to love each other a little more...more carefully...maybe become a happy family...that's all I want Hector is for us to be a happy family. Tears are streaming down her face.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never had one... (with a broken smile) ...I was hoping... Hector leans over, wipes them off. He kisses her tears away...in love with trouble and the wrong lover. No bette feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at the memories, these wars were fun...and wer all she ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi wakes up alone. Hector is gone. She jumps up ina panic, races out of the room. Down the stairs. Through the living room. Dining room. Into KITCHEN where... The table is set and Hector, in his underwear is busy coo BREAKFAST over the hot stove which is a MESS. He comes ou of the smoke...his son helping him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (casually) Buenos dias, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: (excited) We made fried eggs...and pork chops...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...and beer. She tries to control herself...and enjoy the day.  59.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh...that's beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: I'm joking...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (winking at Puchi) Sit down, honey. It's all okay. I have a crazy idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FAMILY VACATION IN PUERTO RICO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father walks through the simply furnished LIVING ROOM into the KITCHEN busies himself getting some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...how have you been?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: The same I've always been. Hector realizes this ain't a happy reunion.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: So...I'm here...

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I know. I read the papers. Awkward silence. Father gets up, goes inside. After a moment, Hector follows.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: . a drug addict with many arrests and scandals. Yes, I've read about you. His father stops abruptly, walks out. Goes back into the living room, randomly starts cleaning. Hector follows again...but now he wants some answers.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Everyday I do the wrong thing and everyday I find out how to stop from doing the wrong thing...and I'm trying, but I don't stop...I thought that coming here...was the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Why did you come here? I didn't invite you here...  60.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...I wanted to see my father, wanted to surprise you...and I was hoping he wanted to see his son. His father just moves further away...as if Hector wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's it gonna take, viejo? Hector starts looking at OLD FAMILY PHOTOS on the mantel his brother, sister, grandmother. As he picks up one of h father and mother as a young, happy couple... Hector walks closer to his father.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I don't know what it's like to lose your own son. The old man knows, but still turns his back on Hector, lo out the window. As if he knows it too well and now only hears a ghost speaking behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I know how it feels...not to care about living anymore because you grieve and you hurt.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I lost a wife and a son...and you. How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe it's late but, yeah, I'm trying to be your son. Why can't you be my father?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Please, I'm an old man. Leave me in peace.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'll leave...but I'll go on with my life. I love my son...and I can say it! I have no problem with that. Hector walks to the door

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I ever wanted was for you to tell me you loved me and you were proud of me...you can't do that? It's your problem, I've learned to live with it.  61. In his eyes, all the sorrow that gave him all the soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi is in the bed, watching Hector fix his tie in the mirror...dressing up for the show. A show in itself.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Goin' to work early?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Si, gonna surprise Willie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy is stuck in a HUGE TRAFFIC JAM. A sea of headlights. The MIDTOWN TUNNEL up ahead & Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuck in traffic. Hector does a little blow, of course, a if getting higher would get him there faster, but nothing works. The traffic doesn't move. Hector POUNDS on the steering wheel. No cell phones in those days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discouraged FANS leave the club. A disgusted Willie and T Band are leaving as well. They stand on the sidewalk as t band boy lines up the INSTRUMENT CASES. Hector pulls up in his Caddy, double parks. Hector gets out of the car, stoned, crazed. He walks over to Willie who doesn't even acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You're not gonna fuckin' believe it...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: You're right, I won't. Willie walks down the sidewalk. Hector follows.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Pero, Willie. Que pasa? Dejame explicarte. Lemme'splain, man. Willie stops, faces Hector.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Hector, I can't deal with this shit anymore man...tu sabe? I quit. The band is yours.  62.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Tu esta loco chico? You're gonna break this up because of me...? Come on...don't mind me. Man..not now...we're at the top...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Good for you. It's your band. Hector, I can't work with your crazy shit anymore, man. I'm a musician too, remember? I don't like being the 'straight guy', cause I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You're joking right? Ta' jodiendo? You're fucking with me? Willie opens the door to his BUICK ELECTRA. As he puts hi Trombone case in, TWO PRETTY WOMEN walk up to Hector. Hardcore fans.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ONE
dialogues.text: (nervously to Hector) Excuse me...we waited three hours to hear you sing... Hector thinks she's gonna smack him. He backs up.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN TWO
dialogues.text: We really did... She pulls out one of Willie and Hector's RECORD ALBUMS... doesn't hit over the head with them.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN TWO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you sign this? We just love you. Hector smiles and signs the album as Willie, looks and ge in his car.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ONE
dialogues.text: Thank you...hey...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN TWO
dialogues.text: Come on, Wanda. Willie starts the engine. It makes Hector rush over to tr to uselessly stop him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Why don't we go talk quietly you and

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: The car window goes down.  63.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: I told Ralphy to cancel all our gigs. I'm moving on. You do the same. I'll work with you, but not on the same stage. I'm around for you anywhere else... Willie smiles, understanding, but terminal.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...we're family. He drives off. Hector stands stunned, his whole world roc by his own disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks into the house. Puchi is no where in sight and neither is his son.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hello? Mami, where are you? Tito? He looks around. It's too quiet. Goes and searches in the kitchen. No one. MUCH LATER... Hector sees the headlights swing piercingly though the wi across the darkened living room...washing over his face, then settling in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi turns off the lights of the car. She sees that Hect car is there. She's all made up and dressed to kill...or fuck another man. She looks tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes in shielding herself with Tito. Closes the door behind her. Almost TV casual.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHT
dialogues.text: Hector? Before she can hear a reply, Hector's on top of her, swin her across the living room...over a sofa.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Where the fuck were you...you fucking whore, puta de mierda! Puchi lands on the floor...ugly and violent.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Hector...you're crazy! What's gotten into you?  64.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Where the fuck...come on...you're stoned, right? Look at you... She can only come up with a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Look at you... The little boy starts crying and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Please stop it...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I was at my sister's! What's wrong with you.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (to the boy) Was she?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You fucking bastard! Not the kid...! She punches him back, but he doesn't hit back...he just b away, to take a better look at her. To get back harder.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: (screaming) Papi stop...stop!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Dressed like that...como una puta.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Como una puta...and since when don't you like it? He can't answer to that. Hector looks at Tito, who is onc again alone or in the middle...looking at his family, as looking at strangers.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to surprise you...I went by the Club...where were you? Hector is now puzzled, confused, guilty...even is she's n really innocent. He can't speak

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the fuck where you? Hector crumbles down...his turn to cry like a kid himself It's not about believing or not believing her tonight. No one wins.  65.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...I'm sorry Tito... He tries to grab Tito...who refuses and stays alone. It's horrible moment when your own son fears you.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Come on Tito...it's your dad...it's okay...he's just upset at something...not at you...he loves you. She's talks to the boy, while she looks at Hector, playin it out...using the boy, their love, anything to stop him make him believe her story....and find out his. It's love that can only feel through pain and can only exist hurtin each other to make sure they're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is sitting by the bed staring at the wall to wall mirror in front of him. He's numb.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I was late...again. She sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: That motherfucker! What happened? Hector smiles at the absurdity of the end. Speechless.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what? People like you, late. He's nothing without you, fuck him!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Fuck me. I am the one that got fired...He was right, I'm fucking up my career...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He told you that? He looks away from her, goes for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Not in those words.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You're the best. Everybody knows that, Hector. Let him go out there and sing with that squeaky little voice of his...it's his loss. Puchi starts to take off her fancy dress, Hector notices black lingerie. And then...it's back to the start.  66.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Where were you? She's been through this a hundred times. She knows it and so does he.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I went to my sister's and then I got some chicken...I thought you were coming in late. Baby... Hector looks right up at her. Even if his worse suspicion are true, he can't let her go.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gently, motherly) Okay, we're gonna take a couple of Quaaludes, get under the covers and hold on to each other, for a change. When we get up, everything is gonna be okay. She finds the pills, undresses him, gets in the bed and cradles him. They're both feeling numb and peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry Papi, we'll figure it all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector and 'his' band are playing a slow Bolero. He looks alone on stage. Willie's is a confusing loss, another rejection, another brother gone. Now he's a more 'sophisticated' Hector, with the sins and the fads of the moment. Cool, aloof, hardly moving, just the necessary sway for the song...and the mood. Less is more. And the people like him more. The more drama, the more they love him. He has the money, the habit, a future and all the trouble success requires sometimes...but something is off tonight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi finds him sitting alone in his room....he looks tir and worn, his smile crooked and turned off.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: It was my father's birthday today...I called, but he didn't pick up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (like a bad psychiatrist) Maybe he wasn't home.  67.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I tried ten, fifteen times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of NIGHT CRICKETS are heard coming through the open window. As Hector stares at the window and listens his eyes flutter.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You ever tried looking at the Coqui singing? He picks up a little statuette from the night table. It t classic little green frog native of Puerto Rico. The Coqu The little COQUI FROG sits on the bed now...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...in the Bronx...no no, never saw one, you're right? So? She cuddles next to him, he puts her arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You see the Coqui? Their singing is a very special sound....but they only sing in two notes...one tune. That's it...over and over (imitates them) That's all... They thrive everywhere in Puerto Rico but they cannot survive anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (with affection) You are very much like the Coqui, I guess Hector....fuck, you can be depressing, man. Look at me...am I in love with a frog? Tell me you're depressing... She puts her arms around him and hugs him..

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Watch out...I think you got the little frog right under your...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Ouch...you..... (kissing him) On the TV...news. 1974 Viet Nam. The FALL OF SAIGON...the helicopter shot ABOVE THE American embassy.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi blindly feels for Hector in her sleep. Instinct sna her awake. She gets up and sees...a silhouette. HECTOR sitting in a chair, HOLDING A 45 AUTOMATIC and sta at her with a glazed calm over him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHT
dialogues.text: Hector.... He doesn't respond nor acknowledge her getting up.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honey...? You okay? Puchi slowly picks up the phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hushed voice) I need an ambulance, right away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst other concerned families, Zayda sits patiently, attending to her own heartbeat...this is difficult on everybody. Puchi talks to a DOCTOR. WE DON’T HEAR THE CONVERSATION, but we know what they saying.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: . you're aware that your husband is like a walking drugstore? His arms... She cuts in, with a 'please stop the bullshit' left arm gesture that almost hits the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Tell me something' I don't fuckin' know. I wake up and I see my husband lookin' like a character in a horror movie, holding a gun! What the hell is that? IN A WHITE CELL... Hector sits alone, staring off into space. Peacefully tur off. No singing, no talking, no one to watch. Withdrawn and in a drug withdrawal.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...I would've loved checking myself in somewhere and taking a break too...but I couldn't do that. He trembles, shakes, silently begging for a fix, to at le patch things up with himself and go through madness with some dignity.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... The little boy starts picking up the pieces of the broken ceramic ashtray he had so proudly made for his dad. Puchi and Hector stare at their son as he picks up one piece at time...trying to put it back together, something too brok to be fixed ever. MUSIC STARTS. BATA DRUMS PLAY FURIOUSLY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peaceful moment from 103 street. Just below, El Barrio...and under a building in 104 street: HOPE. A SONG IN YORUBA IS HEARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SANTERIA ritual. White robed dancers, chanting in the ancient YORUBA, spinning, calling the deities on, shaking off the evil eye. The white clad drummers, talking to the Gods...playing their specific beat...eyes closed, in a tr  86. We hear his voice singing the powerful song "AGUANILE" The room is lit by candles, the place cluttered with Reli Santeria statues, dolls, artifacts...and believers. A woman in her seventies walks in circles around Hector, stand in the middle of the room. She smokes a cigar, blow the smoke at him...and circles...speaking in tongues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (_ SCENE PLAYS IN SPANISH )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small little place. Santeria objects everywhere. She is talking to Hector and Puchi. Hector's quiet, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MADRINA
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Why don't you accept your gift?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MADRINA
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Your gift of singing. The Lord has given you the power to sing, the power to bring happiness to millions.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) When my mother died I became a singer, I was five years old...pain gave me a voice...I can't throw away my pain. Madrina smiles knowingly. He's trying to be funny. It's t fear.

dialogues.speaker: MADRINA
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) You're walking with the Devil...he pretends he's your friend...actually makes you feel good. He's smart. Hector listens.

dialogues.speaker: MADRINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Hector, the power of the Evil Eye can be very dangerous...he can disguise himself as your pain...stop suffering to make him go away.  87. She gets up, goes over to an ALTAR, takes a WHITE, BLUE A RED BEADED NECKLACE off a STATUE OF SAINT BARBARA. She returns to the tables, kisses the necklace, puts it a his neck.

dialogues.speaker: MADRINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Wear these for protection. Santa Barbara will protect you...and be by your side. She will listen and speak to you. But you better listen. You don't play with the saints.

dialogues.speaker: MC OS
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... 1987 OFF SCREEN we Hector signals the band. They play the intr to "EL TODOPODEROSO". The crowd goes wild. People dancing in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC, dressed cool, funky sunglasses, stands center sta

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: ...the moment you've all been waiting for. El Cantante de Los Cantantes...Hector Lavoe The CROWD goes berserk. Hector is energized by the crowd. Hector walks on stage to thunderous applause. As the MC gives him a hug...Hector looks good. Clean and happy. The MC walks off stage. Hector takes the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: WELL.
dialogues.text: The CROWD cheers. Hector laughs. Looks a little mean, a little too sharp. Deviled.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Why do you like me so much...? Something's gotta be wrong with you? More cheers, whistles. As the CROWD waves their hands bac and forth. FADE singing...THE CONCERT BECOMES SLOW MO. Even at his happiest or saddest, he could sing...and whatever was goi through his brain, made a stop at his face first...as tho eyes, those eyes where everything showed.  88.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...-he was tired...it was like...it was like a religious experience between him and his fans... That was it. He hated it but depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector sits at the table eating dinner as Puchi sits acro from him and eats him up with her eyes. Who's cheating wh

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ..,anyway, I had sent Tito home with my sister...we wanted to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector, cigarette in his mouth, sits watching the news. He puts his hands in his pocket, comes out with a lighter and TWO GLASSINE BAGS of HEROIN.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: .. he was trying...my God... He tosses the BAGS on the coffee table. He lights the cigarette, taking big drags as his eyes go back and forth from the TV to the BAGS. He rests the cigarette on the table, TAKES OFF HIS SANTER NECKLACE, sets it down then picks up the BAGS and walks i the BATHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi races into the living room. SMOKE EVERYWHERE. She searches through the smoke. Sees the bathroom door ajar, races over, rips it open to find Hector nodded out on the toilet. FLAMES all around him. Puchi shakes him, grabs his hand, they run upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...he passed out on the couch and dropped his cigarette...So I woke him up. We couldn't get out the front so he grabbed me by the hand and raced up the stairs...all of the sudden he became Superman. A FLASH: HECTOR ON STAGE... TALKING TO HIS AUDIENCE SOMEWHERE ELSE...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...everybody's saying something different version of what happened (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: but me...someone said: 'Oh...he was free-basing'...he was so high he thought he was Superman' and flew out the window...Jesus...can a man just drop a cigarette butt in the wrong place and start a little fire...? The looks at the cigarette in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck them! The crowd cackles, cheers. No matter what he did wrong, i made him more part of them.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...God knows...there were a million stories.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI TODAY
dialogues.text: An old photo shows the wall of the 55 Street Apt.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: People like Hector lend themselves to fantasy and to be what everybody wanted his history to be...you know what I'm saying? A million stories... Puchi looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUCCI PUCHI. A beauty in designer everything. She takes a big drag on her cigar, inhales the smoke, blows out the s in her new living room. On the wall, we see... LEG CASTS ENCASED IN GLASS. She's like a caged animal walking aroun the empty apartment.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...and that's how we got those. Everybody who was anybody in the business came by and signed em' ya know. Like a church service. That was the at the last place we had...yeah. The CAMERA scans the walls donned with artwork over to th hall with all the gold records. A bored looking teenager Tito comes out of his room. Bumps into his crazed mother He looks like a very spoiled kid.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Where are you going tonight?  90.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Don't know...anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You're just gonna hit the sidewalk and decide what you're doing...don't talk to me like I'm your grandmother or something...if I ask where the fuck you're going, you tell me...and if you don't know where you're going, you make it up....but please don't say...you don't know...that's pretty lame. Come here. The young man comes over....

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Mom please... She hugs him, as if he was still her little baby.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Please what...? She holds on to him, giving him all the love she can. She knows what being this age was like. It's scary today.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: Ok...I love you. He hugs her even tighter ON THE HALLWAY... Tito comes out, shows his waiting buddy a peek of the GUN HIS WAISTBAND...they slap five. ONA TV... HECTOR IS SINGING. We see him on a TV monitor in the greenroom. His PIXILATE face, like A MAP OF ALL THE PAIN IN THE WORLD. He sings t slow blues bolero: "Taxi". At times looking straight at t CAMERA...as if straight at Puchi....straight at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, cushy VIP room. Buffet table. Full bar. Hector on Tv. A drunk and hostile Puchi sits on the couch ranting t Zaida as other VIP's try to turn a deaf ear. This is the MONSTER she's turned into, by choice or by design. She glances over to a WOMAN in a low cut dress.  91.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (loud whisper ) Look at that bitch over there with her tits hangin' out. She's been wantin' to fuck Hector for years.

dialogues.speaker: ZAIDA
dialogues.text: I hear ya baby, I hear ya. Did she? Puchi doesn't listen, she's just ranting.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (loudly) Nobody would have been here if it wasn't for me. There would have been NO concert if it wasn't for me.

dialogues.speaker: ZAIDA
dialogues.text: Shit, Hector's lucky you don't sing "cause you'd be doin' that to. They "slap five" together. Cookie sneaks his head in the room. Zayda gets up and leaves for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: ZAIDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta pee. Another WOMAN looks over at Puchi.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (to the woman) That's right bitch. Who's dick did you suck to get in here? The prudent 'bitch' ignores her. Ralph walks into the roo gives the woman a kiss. The woman points to Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: His.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (to Ralph) Hey, Baldy, where's my money? Ralph ignores Puchi, takes the woman's hand and walks out Puchi stays alone in a fog...no one left to insult. She looks bitter, worn and all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is walking through the nondescript door. Papo, see him from inside his car. Doesn't say hello or call him.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see you hand in front of your face. A four piece BA plays to beautiful people: drug dealers, musicians, gangs A tired Hector pretends to grin and act normal. Cookie is sitting next to him in a private booth, next to a bottle Curvosier.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...-Maybe I rent a small apartment somewhere in Jersey...I gotta do something, man. I'm afraid to stay, but more afraid to go. Hector looks at the band, as they play to the damaged cro this late...or this early. Yes, he remembers those nights Cookie breaks the spell with something imprudent to say.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: You know...It's none of my business what she does, but it's my business that she doesn't get you arrested. He nods to Hector, proud that 'he's said it'.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What are you talking about now?

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Hector, something I heard...from a good source...it's not 'bochinche'.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What is it? Stop preparing me for it.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: She's dealing coke...small time, a gram here and there...but that's the last thing you need, it's been going on for a while...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Puchi? She doesn't need the money... Hector turns pale, as the spotlight hits his face, but ha no time to digest it. They're spotted.

dialogues.speaker: BAND LEADER
dialogues.text: Hector...we see you. Come up and sing!...You're under arrest...you can't run. We need a singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost a REPRISE of that night where it all started something years ago. Him and his old friend...and a band without a singer.  93. Everyone looks at him and applauds as he gets up and walk on to the small stage. Cookie sits on the piano, bad hand and all. He starts to REPRISE the GONE OLD days. The old Tejedor classic " ESCANDALO". After a couple of heart felt verses, the trumpet player g ona solo. He sees Puchi coming in. His face changes into fear...because he sees something in her eyes he's never s before. She looks scary as she floats closer to the stage, walkin like a zombie...VINTAGE MADNESS...with a twist. Heads tur People laugh. But it's not funny. Hector imagines the wor Hector motions to a BOUNCER, who steps in and grabs her. It's another degrading moment.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Let go... Hector looks at her as she falls on the floor...trying to pull the bouncer to spit him, to kiss her, to spit him again...taunting the man, like a sloppy drunk, nothing se about it. She is dragged off screaming and foaming at the mouth...but this time is different...it's difficult.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You motherfucker! Look what they're doing to your wife...do something you prick...you junkie little faggot...come on! But Hector does nothing as they take her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty street. Puchi is stumbling and ranting in the sidewalk. It's the end of the night and New York feels em except for this crazed woman with a torn dress and a torn heart.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You coward...no wonder your own son fucking hates you! She shoves him again. He stumbles for words.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Come on...st...stop...I can't...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (assassinating) You can't raise your son. You can't even be a husband...You cant' even fucking sing anymore. Hector starts to unravel himself, he puts his head in his hands. She rests for a second against a parked car  94.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about now? What is it with you? Why are you doing this...? Then Puchi backs him into the wall...preps him for the killshot. Lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: You don't have a son.... He starts to slump down against the wall. She grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You hear me?! As he looks up, eyes glazed over...EVERYTHING GETS SLOW A HORRIFYING.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you saying? She painfully tries to reach him, to hold on to something She collapses into his arms, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it...? Sees Puchi...knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: (choking on her words) Tito's dead...he's dead...there was an accident...with a gun...and...he was shot...a friend shot him. INTERVIEW - PUCHI SEARCHES THE ROOM FOR HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi is silent. Her eyes finally LAND on a corner of the room and stay there. The Camera rolls silently, until she returns to the Interview.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...I thought I'd die too...but you live through it...and it hurts much more. Hector? He died with him... A COLOR PHOTO OF TITO FILLS THE SCREEN... it's surrounded by flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector's eyes are filled with tears. He touches the microphone, it's almost like he's going to start a song.  95. He and Puchi stand by Tito's grave with a crowd of friend and family behind them.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...is not like you can bring him back, like he went to the store...it's something impossible to believe. You can believe in anything in life, you know... no matter how crazy it is...but not this...so...we're here, but we're not here... Hector is unraveling emotionally, but he musters up a smi not for him, not for the people there, but for Tito.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See Tito...we're playing hide and seek...for the rest of our lives...but I'm gonna find you where you're hiding... He walks away from the microphone. Puchi doesn't even tou him, he's stays alone. More alone than ever INTERVIEW...Puchi is crying too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very quiet...only distant traffic in the background. A firetruck in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...your son's smiling at you one day, you turn around and the next thing you know he's gone...no one prepares for that...all the death in the world doesn't get you ready for that... (lights a cigarette) ...and I've seen a lot of dying around me...I grew up in streets where they would drop like flies...but for Hector it was very hard...it was something he never got over. Nothing was the same again...life changed and for the two of us...it was never the same again...he died, we died...that simple. She touches her face with his hand...as if it was him caressing her...not letting her get so sad. A tear coming out her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi's eyes swollen with tears. Cookie comes over, hands her a plate of food, she can't have anything.  96. Puchi looks for him through the crowd in the apartment at the post funeral reception.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Thanks...where's my husband? A flash of panic rushes over Cookie's face. He quickly sc the room...No Hector. Cookie looks back at Puchi, knowing what's going through head. Suddenly Hector comes out of the kitchen. Sees he's across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right after the funeral, He's still wearing the suit and tie...Puchi looks dead sitting in the red sofa...expressionless. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...you and I never talk, never been straight for more than three hours a day, that was when we first met maybe...twenty years ago? And we just go on with life like this... (looking around) like...this is our life and it's never gonna stop...or something like that..... I love you...but it's impossible to... She starts talking on her own, like two parallel conversations.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...impossible to...oh, I get it...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: you know...see, like that...you.. ...but he stops, fearful of what she'd do next.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Oh... now that our son is dead it all comes clear to you. I'ma bitch and you're a great guy...and that maybe the best thing for us to do, besides fucking other people...is to make it official, that you and I have all of the fucking sudden realized 'we ain't good' for each other, so we're breaking it up to try to fix it up...fix what up? She paces around the room, like a bull before going into ring. Gives him a hard, cold look.  97.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This? She turns to one of the mirrored walls. We see on the fractured mirrored tiles the two of them. In broken love. THEIR FACES DISSOLVING INTO...BUBBLES. A LIGHTER FLICKS ON. The dope bubbles, cooking in the filthy spoon. Hector lig a Cigarette, now he's got all the time in the world. Noth will stop him to wipe all the pain away. It's serene mome before communion. QUICK CUTS... He ties off his arm. Takes the syringe and slips the need into his vein. RED BLOOD SHOOTS UP INSIDE THE DROPPER...L A SERPENTINE...a deadly STREAMER spooling on CARNIVAL DAY SKELETAL SALSA music plays over. A BASS, A SCRATCH, A LON TRUMPET. ..ECHOES.

dialogues.speaker: LATER...
dialogues.text: Hector stares at the TV, holding an ice cream bar that dr down his chest...watching the static on the TV. He's filthy, unshaven, a burned down cigarette dangling f his mouth. As he points to an invisible person, the noddi junkies open their eyes and see nothing. He gets up to gr the INVISIBLE. Talks to the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Abuela?...What are you doing here? How did you find me? Doing a woman's voice...playing the GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR/ABUELA
dialogues.text: They told me. I came to take you home. It's chilling theater...the never ending tragic-comedy of his life.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (frightened) No, no...I can't...I can't go home.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR/ABUELA
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that...you are my favorite...my little one.  98. Goes over to the spot where 'she stands'.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: No, no, you don't understand Grandma...I killed my little boy.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR/ABUELA
dialogues.text: Hector, you killed no one.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: See...he needed me. That's all. I should have given him more attention...more love. I thought I had...but I was too busy with... He looks at his small junkie audience, half dead pieces o men and women, staring at him, watching the surreal performance.

dialogues.speaker: JUNKIE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Tito's happy, man. Your son's with God. Hector stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? Hicks the table in front of her...works and dope and bott flying into the wall... The dope fiends do nothing, it's all normal to them. Hect sees what's left of him in a sliver of a mirror hanging f the filthy wall...half a face. Half alive. All pain. He closes his eyes and drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is sitting alone. He sits up to look better as the Doctor walks in with a folder in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: So? The Doctor sits across from him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It scares me when you sit down.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It should. (he opens the folder) Cholesterol is okay...sugar is a little off...prostate is fine...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: But?  99. The Doctor stops the act. Closes his prop folder. Looks straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: The HIV test came back positive... Hector shakes his head, as if he didn't hear well...as if was spoken to in a foreign language he suddenly understan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector walks alone, surrounded by the bright lights. But looks pensive and distant, carrying bad news, one after another. A street musician blows on a saxophone in front a store window...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR OS
dialogues.text: I don't blame her...she's more scared than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new place looks a mess. Hector, in a running suit, si in a fog pretending to watch TV. He looks frail, sad and abandoned. Willie is sitting next to him. Hector keeps hi eyes on the TV...where we see RUN DMC in some music show. It's the future in front of their eyes, but neither man s it.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: ...she tested fine. She goes out goes anywhere. He shakes his head. Anyone could'a seen it coming.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah...and we move on.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: The phone doesn't ring except for the bill collectors...and fucking wrong numbers...I'm like 'hello, digame, hello...like, may I help you?' You know, whatever...hey, 'talk to me... Ok? Fuck you. Good-bye'. He smiles. Ralph sits, appeals to him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Well, I am here....and there are people still waiting for you to... sing again...to see you. They feel for you, man, they've mourned with you...but they need you...these people love you Hector. No matter what. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But they're not gonna wait forever You know how it is... (beat) You got a show in Puerto Rico. Take it. That bothers Hector, but he makes no big deal of it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let the people know you are alive. Instead he looks at Willie as if he agrees with everythin except for the being alive part.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You know me....I don't listen to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Great. Biggest decisions ever in life have been made without thinking about them. Chevere. (looking in the eye) Your problem is, that you're a lucky guy. He thinks for a second. Looking straight back at Willie.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I deserve to be. Shit, I wish I was the president...good luck didn't want to do anything with me... Willie smiles, listening to his old friend riffing, like improvising in they're good old on stage.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had more than good luck...and I had you motherfucker. The two old friends embrace one another. An embrace that' been waiting for years. PUERTO RICO...home again.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Hector looks out the window at the PUERTO RICAN COUNTRYSI mountains, valleys, panoramic view of the ocean. He close his eyes as he breathes in that wonderful island smell. I gives him life.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (gently) It's beautiful, right? (singing) Why do we leave?  101. Cookie looks straight at the road ahead of him...can't te what's on Hector's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd carrying Puerto Rican flags and "Hector Lavoe" ba files into the half empty stadium. A different excitement is happening backstage. A bad scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scattered crowd screams out his name. The band waits. Ralph puffs on a cigar, looking out at the anxious crowd Hector and Cookie arrive. The Promoter comes over, appeals to Hector

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Hector, I'm sorry about the situation. I didn't wanna cancel but Ralphy...but there's no one here. They didn't show up, it's not my fault! It hits Hector. His people didn't show up? He stares as t others fight the wrong fight.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Hey! What the fuck you doin' talking to the Artists? What you better do is walk out on that fuckin' stage and tell the crowd the show's canceled! (to the band) Go back to the hotel, guys. They all wait loyally by Hector.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: (panicked) Are you crazy? I'll have a riot! (to Hector) Ralphy wants all the money up front. I told him I'd have it...but look...no one came. Hector's eyes are on the crowd, the flags, the banners. E if it is just a few of his people, that made it more spec

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: It's cool. I just wanna sing. Forget about the money, this one is on me. Ralph turns. Foaming at Hector's suggestion...showing his power or rather, Hector's lack of it.  102.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hector, are you crazy? What the fuck are you now; Saint Hector? I already sent all the other acts back to the hotel...this ain't a welfare concert.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Relax, I'll give you your commission anyway...I just want to sing.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: That's not the point! They're tearing down the stage... Hector stops him with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (yelling) Come on, vamos. Hector walks ON STAGE with the band. The crowd stands cheering...but it's chaos out there. He grabs the mic. THUNDER IS HEARD... The band plugs in...and tentatively takes their places.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Que pasa mi gente! I'm here, all yours! The band starts playing. Hector sings. A tropical storm breaks...heavy rain starts pouring, but the show goes on. Until the sound starts going out instrument by instrument until only Hector's mic is on. He looks off stage to the SOUND MEN behind Ralph and Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put the sound back on!

dialogues.speaker: SIDE STAGE
dialogues.text: Ralph throws his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I fuckin' told him! Cookie goes up to the sound board.

dialogues.speaker: COOKIE
dialogues.text: Put that shit back on... Cookie looks around for the Promoter...gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector motions his PERCUSSION section.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Give me some Congas... The Conga starts a beat...steady and strong. Hector is soaking wet ready, as close to the audience as he can be. Hector starts singing again...but his mic is suddenly tur off...only the lonely Conga and a couple of horns try to fight it out. Hector keeps singing, but the audience can' hear him. The rain pouring down on him, like tears runnin down his face. He tries to shouts the song out...but no one can listen a the thunder rolls and the rain drowns out the voice of a alone on stage...crying out the lyrics to "Mi Gente"...bu his people are now just about to start a RIOT. THING TURN INTO SLOW MOTION. A chair FLIES THROUGH THE RAIN...lands next to him. SCREAMS CONTINUE... mixed with the last dying conga sounds... audience echoes and hotel Muzak. A bad recipe cacophony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horror has followed to the bar in lobby of the Sherat where Hector and Puchi are having it out in front of all other band members, crew, strangers. They fight, but we don't hear a sound...we've heard plent of fighting and can only imagine. There is no truce ever with these two. ALL THE SOUNDS FADE OUT... and we only hear the sound of the ocean. Low, night waves...and the barely audible music from a bar blocks aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to the empty suite. Eerily quiet now. Hect walks in. At the end of the room, we see the empty balcon (a REPRISE of once in the late 60's...) He walks through the room, opens the sliding door. Hector steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's finally PEACEFUL. Hector takes a look at the ocean beneath him, the palm trees. Listens to the waves...and feels the strange tranquility around him. He smiles, with very sad look in his face. An emptiness i his eyes BEFORE THEY SHUT TIGHT. A SIREN BLARES...  104.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Hector's completely shattered and broken body is laid out a stretcher, an oxygen mask over face. Paramedics frantic work to keep him alive as Puchi rocks back and forth, pra

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: God, please help him...please help him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puchi sits all alone and silent in the waiting room. It's sad lonely picture. The game is over. This is where the l road ends. What we hear is Puchi telling the tale.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI OS
dialogues.text: ...he jumped from the ninth floor... Had multiple fractures, broken bones and massive bruising to all his inner organs, which... are already pretty damaged from all the alcohol and drug abuse. His Liver his Kidneys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERVIEW--- Puchi's looking away from the CAMERA...A LIT RESTLESS. Too many memories stirred, too many questions that are answered now, years after the fact...too many 'I wish that I' moments...too much pain and regret.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: He lived...yeah...five more years. She thinks about what she says...putting together some se into a tough past or coming up with final days wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it wasn't real life... She looks straight at CAMERA, AT US...as we hear applause the intro to a song.

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and I wasn't there for him. I wanted to remember him like he wanted me to. She closes her eyes. FADE TO BLACK. The HORNS announcing the closing words....the parting shot...and it'll be Hector's turn with his side of the st

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: The sound of Salsa music and Arena crowd builds in volume  105. The audience chanting: HECTOR! HECTOR! HECTOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIDE STAGE - Puchi stands nest to Hector. She looks into his eyes...THE INTRO FOR "Todo Tiene su Final". The encor

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you that I love you...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: I love you too. Go ahead honey, go tell them. I'1l be here. She kisses him. The band picks up the rhythm trying to pu Hector up.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: (singing) ".,.Todo tiene su final, nada dura para siempre... Hector sings it as he knows it. "Everything must come to end, nothing lasts forever...." A Prophetic salsa marker his life. It's hurts a bit. THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE follows as he stands walks ON STAGE, singing...every movement he makes: easy, poignant...givin Hector spreads his arms to his fans...sheer adulation. CLOSE ON PUCHI, HER FACE...as if watching him. BUT WE'RE BACK TO THE INTERVIEW.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW OS
dialogues.text: Do you miss him?

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: Everyday. Do you think that you can forget someone like that? they're all around you...wherever you go...he chases me...people like Hector you don't escape...you resign yourself to living your life with an invisible man...with a ghost...sometimes I'm cooking something, whatever...and I ask him 'hey Hector how do you want...?' You know...like he was there...it never goes away...people say, go ahead Puchi...there are a lot of better more normal men around...did I ever want that? you figure it out.  106. She looks around the room, more comfortable with the confession. Near the end. Out of words. Out of heart. BACK TO SCENE... Hector singing his heart out.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW OS
dialogues.text: What would you tell him if he was here today ? She is caught by surprise with this question. She shakes her head with a wishful smile...

dialogues.speaker: PUCHI
dialogues.text: ...you don't wanna know what I'd tell him. She laughs, making light of something so heartbreaking. But the lyrics of the song we hear say for her. ‘Everythi must come to an end'... and this love story definitely di Just listen to him. ( SONG WILL BE SUBTITLED) A CU FLASH OF PUCHI 2002: Outside MSG...staring at THE PA BACK TO... Hector singing, his inimitable style, ease in front of thousands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show goes on. "TODO TIENE SU FINAL" continues. Title Cards over concert shots: Hector Lavoe died of AIDS complications on June 23, 1993. was 43 years old. He is considered to be the greatest Sal singer of his time and always remembered as a folk hero because he was "Of the people for the people." HECTOR SINGING ON STAGE, waving.... ANOTHER TITLE CARD.... Nilda 'Puchi' Roman Perez, died in 2002 of mysterious circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Mi gente...te quiero de gratis! A fan throws a PUERTO RICAN FLAG on stage. Johnny rushes over picks up the flag, drapes it over Hector. Twenty thousand fans strong cheering. Hector gives the POWER SIG to his people. THE MUSIC PLAYS ON...  107. Puchi blows him a kiss, he smiles...and turns to his audi FOREVER.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: THE CROWDS CHEER...he dances, lost in himself. This is ho we all want to remember him. He looks around at the audie No big deal. Life gave him everything...and he never knew it. A cheer brings a smile to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but now we see the STOCK FOOTAGE of thousands of his f in the streets of the Bronx paying tribute to another gon Hero...mixed in with "Our Latin Thing" SNIPPETS of an UNFORGETTABLE TIME. The people, the music, the singer...the images all SLOWIN DOWN, transcending the magic and the spell now put on us.  108.
